Text.Language: Tennah] e~ounou] n~ouwt: Vnou] Viwt pipantokratwr: v/e~tafyamio n~t~ve nem p~kahi: n/e~tounau e~rwou nem n/e~te n~cenau e~rwou an.
We believe in one God, God the Father, the Pantocrator, Creator of heaven and earth, and of all things seen and unseen.

Tennah] e~ou[oic n~ouwt I/couc Pi,~rictoc Ps/ri m~Vnou] pimonogen/c: pimici e~bolqen Viwt qajwou n~nie~wn t/rou:
We believe in one Lord, Jesus Christ, the only-begotten Son of God, begotten of the Father before all ages.

ououwini e~bolqen ououwini: ounou] n~tav~m/i e~bolqen ounou] n~tav~m/i: oumici pe ouyamio an pe ouo~mooucioc pe nem Viwt: v/e~ta hwb niben swpi e~bol hitotf.
Light of Light, true God of true God; begotten, not created; of one essence with the Father; by whom all things were made.

Vai e~te eyb/ten a~non qa nirwmi nem eybe penoujai: afi~ e~pec/t e~bolqen t~ve: af[icarx e~bolqen Pip~neuma eyouab nem e~bolqen Maria ]paryenoc ouoh aferrwmi.
Who for us men and for our salvation came down from heaven, was incarnate of the Holy Spirit and of the Virgin Mary, and became man.

And He was crucified for us under Pontius Pilate, suffered and was buried;

Comment.Language: Skip to â€œYes, we believe in the Holy Spirit...â€?

Text.Language: Ouoh auerc~taurwnin m~mof e~h~r/i e~jwn nahren Pontioc Pilatoc: afsepemkah ouoh aukocf. Ouoh aftwnf e~bolqen n/eymwout qen pie~hoou m~mahsomt kata nig~rav/.
And He was crucified for us under Pontius Pilate, suffered and was buried, and on the third day He rose from the dead according to the Scriptures.

Afsenaf e~p~swi e~niv/oui: afhemci caouinam m~pefiwt. Ke palin f~n/ou qen pefw~ou e~]hap e~n/etonq nem n/eymwout: v/e~te tefmetouro ouaymounk te.
Ascended into the heavens; He sits at the right hand of His Father, and He is coming again in His glory to judge the living and the dead, whose kingdom shall have no end.

Ce tennah] e~Pip~neuma eyouab P[oic n~ref] m~p~wnq: v/eyn/ou e~bolqen V~iwt: ceouwst m~mof ce] w~ou naf nem Viwt nem Ps/ri: v/e~tafcaji qen nip~rov/t/c.
Yes, we believe in the Holy Spirit, the Lord, the Giver of Life, who proceeds from the Father, who with the Father and the Son, is worshiped and glorified, who spoke by the prophets.

Eoui n~a~gia n~kayolik/ n~a~poctolik/ n~ekk~l/cia. Tenero~mologin n~ouwmc n~ouwt e~p~,w e~bol n~te ninobi.
And in one holy, catholic (universal), and apostolic Church. We confess one baptism, for the remission of sins.
